Country:
"Abelam  
**Region:** Oceania  
**Languages:** Abelam, Tok Pisin, English  
**Religion:** Indigenous/Animist  
**Key Norms:**  
High-context communication  
Collectivist society  
Ritual and tradition highly valued"
Etiquette Notes: Respect for elders  \nAvoid direct eye contact with authority
Interpreter Notes: Use gender-matched interpreters when possible  \nExpect storytelling and metaphors instead of direct answers
Client Onboarding Notes: Establish trust slowly  \nAvoid rushed business talk
Workplace Insights: Community decisions may override individuals  \nRitual involvement may impact scheduling
Historical Context: Rooted in ancestral land ties and yam cult ceremonies  \nColonial impact minimal in rural zones

"https://example.com/abelam-flag.png  
**Point-to-Language Supported:** No  
**PGLS Language Match:** Abelam  
**Communication Style:** High-context, Indirect  
**Touch Norms:** Avoid Touch, Gendered Touch Norms  
**Time Orientation:** Polychronic  
**Gender Role Dynamics:**  
Men lead rituals  
Women support community structure"

Country:
"Northern Ireland  
**Region:** Europe  
**Languages:** English, Irish Gaelic, Ulster Scots  
**Religion:** Christianity  
**Key Norms:**  
Reserved communication  
Respect for privacy and personal space  
Community-oriented with individualist undertones"
Etiquette Notes: "Use inclusive, non-partisan language  \nAvoid assumptions about religious identity"
Interpreter Notes: Take care not to reference divisive political history  \nNeutral tone is essential
Client Onboarding Notes: Business etiquette follows British norms  \nPoliteness expected in meetings
Historical Context: Long history of sectarian conflict  \nPeace accords transformed governance

"https://example.com/northern-ireland-flag.png  
**Point-to-Language Supported:** Yes  
**PGLS Language Match:** Irish Gaelic  
**Communication Style:** Low-context, Indirect, Formal  
**Touch Norms:** Handshake, Avoid Touch  
**Time Orientation:** Monochronic  
**Gender Role Dynamics:**  
Legal gender equality  
Leadership still male-dominated"

Country:
"São Tomé e Príncipe  
**Region:** Africa  
**Languages:** Portuguese, Forro, Angolar, Principense  
**Religion:** Christianity, Indigenous/Animist  
**Key Norms:**  
Respect for elders  
Informality in rural life"
Etiquette Notes: Greeting elders first is essential  \nOffer help to elders or guests
Interpreter Notes: Clarify dialect preference (Portuguese vs. Forro)  \nExplain terminology when switching registers
Client Onboarding Notes: Expect flexible timekeeping  \nBuild rapport before diving into logistics
Workplace Insights: Bureaucratic traditions  \nHierarchy observed in formal settings
Historical Context: Creole island culture  \nLegacy of plantation slavery and Catholicism
Visual Symbols: "São Tomé flag, traditional musical instruments, red cloth"
Image:
"https://example.com/sao-tome-flag.png  
**Point-to-Language Supported:** Yes  
**PGLS Language Match:** Portuguese  
**Communication Style:** High-context, Indirect  
**Touch Norms:** Hug/Gesture, Gendered Touch Norms, Culturally Variable  
**Time Orientation:** Polychronic  
**Gender Role Dynamics:**  
Women often lead households  
Matrilineal land traditions exist"

Country:
"Togo  
**Region:** Africa  
**Languages:** French, Ewe, Kabye, Mina  
**Religion:** Christianity, Islam, Indigenous/Animist  
**Key Norms:**  
Deference to elders  
Age and title matter in introductions"
Etiquette Notes: Greet everyone before business  \nAvoid rushing negotiations
Interpreter Notes: Verify preferred language (Ewe vs. French)  \nRespect gender and formality dynamics
Client Onboarding Notes: Explain interpreter’s role in advance  \nDress and conduct formally in meetings
Workplace Insights: Government jobs tied to political loyalty  \nVertical hierarchy common
Historical Context: "German, British, and French colonial periods  \nIndependence in 1960"
Image:
"https://example.com/togo-flag.png  
**Point-to-Language Supported:** Yes  
**PGLS Language Match:** Ewe  
**Communication Style:** High-context, Formal  
**Touch Norms:** Handshake, Traditional Greeting  
**Time Orientation:** Flexible  
**Gender Role Dynamics:**  
Market women influential  
Men dominate formal institutions"

Country:
"Curaçao / Dutch Antilles  
**Region:** Caribbean  
**Languages:** Papiamentu, Dutch, English, Spanish  
**Religion:** Roman Catholic, Dutch Reformed, Judaism, Afro-Caribbean beliefs  
**Key Norms:**  
Formality in public space  
Cultural blending of African and European norms"
Etiquette Notes: Avoid saying “no” directly  \nAge and gender roles influence greetings
Interpreter Notes: Clarify language (Dutch vs. Papiamentu)  \nBe sensitive to Brua/folk belief taboos
Client Onboarding Notes: Use clear timeframes due to polychronism  \nTitles may matter in Dutch-influenced sectors
Workplace Insights: European norms in professional spheres  \nAfro-Caribbean arts valued socially
Historical Context: "Slavery, trade, and colonial stratification  \nPapiamentu as cultural fusion language"
Image:
"https://example.com/curacao-flag.png  
**Point-to-Language Supported:** Yes  
**PGLS Language Match:** Papiamentu  
**Communication Style:** High-context, Indirect, Gesture-reliant  
**Touch Norms:** Hug/Gesture, Gendered Touch Norms  
**Time Orientation:** Flexible  
**Gender Role Dynamics:**  
Women central in households  
Men dominant in formal settings"
